The CEO used a weak public key to quickly sign urgent contracts. Can you forge their signature on this message? The contract signature: 0x874f5dbc0a13b11138cb95660e12420a936322d21f9a831a0570738eaf0818034fb62d52a282af9b3235e83250479e3b11c01a40b48063ca394a8723f9c3176b

Public Key (n, e): (7991092845811276481191131380356135223905358522866445522025175698053049043162265152195205070974844809703148363318479466660688236807025831923486667725745527, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{4esge2f6}
ciphertext: 0x874f5dbc0a13b11138cb95660e12420a936322d21f9a831a0570738eaf0818034fb62d52a282af9b3235e83250479e3b11c01a40b48063ca394a8723f9c3176b
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (7991092845811276481191131380356135223905358522866445522025175698053049043162265152195205070974844809703148363318479466660688236807025831923486667725745527, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
